snippet: A Fabergé figurine of Empress Alexandra’s Cossack bodyguard that was found in an attic will be auctioned at Stair Galleries in Hudson, N.Y.
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; Faberge figurine of Empress Alexandra’s Cossack bodyguard that was found in attic will be auctioned at Stair Galleries in Hudson, NY; Susan Jaffe Tane, collector who purchased original Poe text of 1840s poem The Conqueror Worm, retracts bid after doubt arise as to its authenticity; estate of historian Kristina Barbara Johnson is being auctioned; Willard House & Clock Museum in North Grafton, Mass, opens Early American musical clock exhibit.
lead_paragraph: A Fabergé figurine of Empress Alexandra’s Cossack bodyguard that was found in an attic will be auctioned at Stair Galleries in Hudson, N.Y.

headline.main: Forgotten Fabergé Comes Out of the Attic
headline.print_headline:
Forgotten Fabergé
Comes Out of the Attic
